title: (x) James Morrison Typeface - modified Windsor Bold {Rainer}
content:
Does anyone have an idea of what typeface James Morrison is using on his album covers?

[http://www.asai8008.com/diary/undiscovered.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830014743/http:/www.asai8008.com/diary/undiscovered.jpg "http://www.asai8008.com/diary/undiscovered.jpg")  
 [http://images.amazon.com/images/P/B000O78XMQ.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830014743/http:/images.amazon.com/images/P/B000O78XMQ.jpg "http://images.amazon.com/images/P/B000O78XMQ.jpg")  
 [http://www.geetune.com/geetune/uploadedImages/News/James%20Morrison-Song...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830014743/http:/www.geetune.com/geetune/uploadedImages/News/James%20Morrison-Songs%20For%20You%20Truths%20For%20Me%20%20%20.jpg "http://www.geetune.com/geetune/uploadedImages/News/James%20Morrison-Songs%20For%20You%20Truths%20For%20Me%20%20%20.jpg")
author: adamschoales

comments.content:
If you like Windsor, perhaps you like Heroine? It's like Windsor had a baby born in the 40's then this baby had a baby born in the 70's and when that baby grew up, Heroine was born.

[http://fountaintype.com/typefaces/heroine](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830014743/http:/fountaintype.com/typefaces/heroine "http://fountaintype.com/typefaces/heroine")

If Windsor is one parent of Heroine, then ITC Clearface would be the other.

- Lex

Cool. It's going to make it trickier for me to do what I'm trying to do, but at least I'll have a starting base.

Cheers!
